text:
Hi, I'm trying to populate a hidden form field with page title. The HubSpot form is embedded on a HubSpot landing page.

I've added the following to head html but it doesn't populate the field at all. Any ideas?

`<script>`
  `window.addEventListener('message', event => {`
    `if(event.data.type === 'hsFormCallback' && event.data.eventName === 'onFormSubmit') {`
      `$('input[name="hidden_property_name"]').val(document.title).change();`
    `}`
  `});`
`</script>`

Hi
I am sending ajax to third party url


ajax url automatically changed from http into https

not sure why

for example

I am sending the request <http://google.com>

but when I check in the browser it shows<https://google.com>

not sure why

can anyone tell me about the reason for it?

how to solve this?

I’m not too familiar with DNS resolution but my guess is that this is a security measure being enforced by the resolver to automatically force traffic over a secure connection. Github pages has something similar where you can force visits to http:// to go to https://

What’s the issue with sending the request over https?
